data.title: Dash Venture Labs: Our Weekly Picks (Issue No. 29)
data.meta_description: 1. Entrepreneurship/Startups Celebrity entrepreneurs Deepak Chopra, Patrice Evra and Metta World Peace to expand business ventures in Abu Dhabi Three global celebrities today signed Letters of Commitment to establish their respective businesses in Abu Dhabi, including Meditation guru Deepak Chopra,
data.text:
1. Entrepreneurship/Startups

Celebrity entrepreneurs Deepak Chopra, Patrice Evra and Metta World Peace to expand business ventures in Abu Dhabi

Three global celebrities today signed Letters of Commitment to establish their respective businesses in Abu Dhabi, including Meditation guru Deepak Chopra, Manchester United icon Patrice Evra and NBA Los Angeles Lakers legend Metta World Peace. The three are in the UAE capital as part of Maven Global Access’ business expansion program, Access Abu Dhabi, supported by the Abu Dhabi Investment Office (ADIO).

Maven Global Access’ Access Abu Dhabi program supports the three celebrities to fast-track their expansion to Abu Dhabi. Deepak Chopra will establish a strong foothold in Abu Dhabi’s Web3 ecosystem with his ChopraVerse, a first-of-its-kind platform that empowers a culture of well-being in the metaverse. Patrice Evra is taking the creativity he is known for on the football pitch to the business landscape through a new content company. While Metta World Peace’s Artest Management Group’s XvsX Sports will bring competitive basketball experiences to cities globally for men and women.

Duqe Free Zone, Mashreq Bank to promote SME growth

UAE’s Duqe partnered with the Ports, Customs and Free Zone Corporation (PCFC) and Mashreq Bank to offer startups and entrepreneurs faster access to banking services. This partnership will help address the challenge of opening a business bank account by simplifying and expediting the opening process for Duqe’s customers. The businesses under Duqe Free Zone will benefit from API integration and banking services through Mashreq’s digital business banking platform, NEOBiz.

Wio Bank, ADGM join hands to improve banking for SMEs

Wio Bank partnered with Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM), the international financial centre of the UAE’s capital, to bolster collective efforts to support SMEs in the UAE to gain access to key banking services quickly and efficiently. With this partnership, Wio will extend its Wio Business platform to SMEs registered with ADGM and provide them with fast-tracked application submission with the opportunity to access financial services, through direct and indirect financing solutions and digital services.

2. Technology

GCC fintech hubs 'must build on billion-dollar momentum

According to Strategy&, Middle East, sustainable fintech growth will boost financial services and the GCC’s overall ambitions of economic diversification and increased innovation. The number of fintech hubs in the GCC has risen from just one in 2018 to four in 2022 - the Abu Dhabi Global Market, Bahrain Fintech Bay, Fintech Saudi, and the FinTech Hive at the DIFC - and the volume of late-stage funding rounds almost doubled in the last five years. New fintech hubs have emerged across the region, funding dynamic small companies, and taking a growing number of them public. In 2021 alone, the volume of late-stage funding rounds totalled USD 2.5 billion, almost double the amount five years ago.

Ministers underscore digital transformation achievements in Saudi Arabia

According to the Digital Government Authority (DGA), government agencies in Saudi Arabia have made great progress in the digital transformation measurement 2022, reaching 80.96% compared to 69.39% in the previous year. The goal of digital transformation in Saudi Arabia is to have better services and fewer digital platforms, and this can be achieved by reducing the number of digital platforms by 50%, to 409 by 2025 from 818 in 2021. Services offered by the Ministry of Health (MoH) through the Seha virtual hospital, the biggest of its kind in the world, as it links more than 152 hospitals around Saudi Arabia. As for the Ministry of Justice, 95% of judicial sessions were provided online, while more than 18 million annual visits to judicial facilities were dispensed with. As for the contributions of the Ministry of Municipal and Rural Affairs and Housing, it has provided more than 190 e-services, through which it meets over 60% of the digital needs of the municipal sector customers through the Baladi platform.

Two Israeli companies join USD 545 million innovation program in Abu Dhabi

Two Israeli companies will be opening new offices in the UAE as part of a USD 545 million government incentive program for innovation-focused firms in high-growth sectors such as agtech, IT, health services and biopharma, and fintech. Israel-based global venture firm OurCrowd will be expanding its existing operations in the UAE with a VC office in Abu Dhabi and an AI tech hub as part of a new agreement. While Israel’s Liquidity Group signed a deal to open an R&D center in the UAE.

Fintech Geidea technology to revolutionize POS transactions for LikeCard

Geidea partnered with UAE-based LikeCard to revolutionize point of sale (POS) transactions for consumers and merchants. Geidea’s one-stop-shop integrated POS terminals will be introduced across Saudi Arabia, the UAE and Egypt. The collaboration with Geidea will see merchants take ownership of the POS terminals, where recharge payments can be completed by consumers through a simple smartphone application.

Crypto-giant Binance secures Abu Dhabi regulator's approval for crypto custody services

World's biggest cryptocurrency exchange, Binance received a Financial Services Permission (FSP) from the Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) in the Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM). The FSP will enable Binance to provide custody to professional clients, provided they meet the conditions of the FSP as outlined by FSRA.

Masdar City and Amazon Web Services sign MoU

Masdar City and Amazon Web Services (AWS) signed a MoU to stage an International Exchange Sprint (IES) in the UAE as part of the AWS Clean Energy Accelerator 3.0. Locations selected for an AWS Clean Energy Accelerator IES align with geographic hotspots for clean energy technology innovation. The proposed collaboration will bring an IES of the AWS Clean Energy Accelerator 3.0 to Masdar City in the fourth quarter of next year, coinciding with COP28, which is being held in the UAE.

Presight AI and Asaren form a strategic partnership

UAE-based Presight AI, a subsidiary of G42, signed an MoU to form a strategic partnership with AsarRen. The partnership will utilize Presight's big data analytics, AI and machine learning solutions, and Asaren's bioinformatics to develop a unique sports analytics platform to enhance performances based on big data and collaboration with leading global sports organizations. The strategic partnership will allow both companies to unlock the potential of this high-growth industry by offering actionable intelligence explicitly tailored to the athlete's precise needs.

ADGM ties up with Rackspace to quicken its journey to cloud

Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM) partnered with Rackspace Technology to collaborate on a number of strategic technology initiatives. Rackspace Technology will support ADGM in its journey to leverage cloud computing and develop a comprehensive business data platform. Cloud migration will enable ADGM to drive cost efficiencies and agility in IT operations, as well as provide a modern, secure technology footprint for the deployment of enhanced business services.

Etisalat by e& partners with RPM to connect ambulances with 5G saving patient lives in real-time

Etisalat UAE, branded as etisalat by e& partnered with Response Plus Holding (RPM) to provide emergency medical services and occupational health solutions in the country to power its fleet of ambulances with remote diagnosis solution and connect patients, ambulance staff and medical experts using the 5G private network for the first time in the UAE. 5G connectivity will arm doctors with critical information to improve patient monitoring and treatment, transferring real-time data such as live HD video to emergency medical technicians (EMTs) in the field or transmitting patient images and data to doctors enroute.

3. Funding Activity

UAE's baraka closes USD 20 million Series A led by Valar Ventures

UAE-based fintech baraka closed a USD 20 million Series A round led by Valar Ventures, the VC’s first regional investment. Knollwood also participated in the round. baraka offers commission-free investing to more than 6000 US stocks and Exchange Traded Funds (ETF). With this new investment, baraka will double down on its presence across the GCC and Egypt, and drive customer acquisition.

Proptech Silkhaus raises USD 7.8 million Seed

UAE-based proptech Silkhaus raised a USD 7.8 million Seed round from Nuwa Capital, Nordstar, Global Founders Capital, Yuj Ventures, Whiteboard Capital, and VentureSouq as well as International family offices, business leaders, and several global proptech entrepreneurs. Silkhaus offers a marketplace for short-term rentals across the UAE. It will utilize funds to expand to the rest of the MENA countries and Southeast Asia.

KLAIM raises USD 5 million Seed from Knuru Capital with plans to increase the round to USD 30 million

UAE-based fintech KLAIM raised a USD 5 million seed round from Knuru Capital with plans to increase this to over USD 30 million by way of a pool of Sharia-compliant investors. The funding will be used to support KLAIM’s medical claims receivable purchasing solution, which allows healthcare providers to access working capital by selling their insurance claims that are pending payment and typically settled between 60 and 112 days.

DataLexing raises USD 3 million seed round led by Sadu Capital

Saudi Arabia-based productivity platform DataLexing raised USD 3 million in a Seed round led by Sadu Capital, with participation from Impact46 and other, unnamed investors. DataLexing helps organisations and individuals acquire data without relying on technical personnel, by bringing insights, apps, notifications, forms, and sheets together in one place. The funding will be used to expand its GCC-wide operations and leverage DataLexing’s development.

CONIX.AI raises USD 1.3 million pre-Seed round led by BIM Ventures

UK-based and Egypt-born design tech CONIX.AI raised USD 1.3 million led by BIM Ventures, announcing the commencement of its commercial activities in Saudi Arabia. CONIX.AI enables real estate developers and architects to generate designs and adaptive materials through its platform using its AI-based solution. It will utilize fund for their expansion into Saudi Arabia and further product development.

Order raises USD 1 million pre-Seed round

Saudi Arabia-based SaaS startup Order raised USD 1 million in a pre-Seed funding round, led by several angel investors. Order provides technical solutions to restaurants and cafe owners to handle their day-to-day operations in Saudi Arabia and Egypt. The round will help Order increase its market share and enhance its services' innovation and development.

Any feedback to share? Contact us
